channel.title: Studying Networking?
channel.description: I recently was in the military doing a logistics role in the navy however i injured myself and cannot go back for 1 year, Currently i am thinking about studying a Diploma of Information technology Networking because i wish to transfer to a more I.T role like a Communication Information Systems (CIS). However the study is not needed to transfer I am just really bored doing nothing for a year and would like to hear peoples opinions on this course if it would be worth it, or what they think of that kind of study?

item.title: Studying Networking?
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

Those wires better be color coated, tied correctly, and have a nice looking chat explain what each and every line is doing. If not you have failed!

Read full topic

item.title: Studying Networking?
item.dc:creator: @krackkid Krackkid
item.description:
@krackkid wrote:

[quote=“Justin Bieber, post:2, topic:555277”]If it’s free what would be the harm?[/quote]Just please manage your wires!

Read full topic

item.title: Studying Networking?
item.dc:creator: @I_InDrEk_I I InDrEk I
item.description:
@I_InDrEk_I wrote:

If you got nothing to do then it’s always better to do something.
And yeah the course itself is worth it especially if you don’t know anything about networking.
So what I imagine it’s going to be about based on what I’ve learned:

[ul][li]DHCP, DNS[/li]
[li]Network schemes[/li]
[li]Cisco routers, packet tracer[/li][/ul]

Read full topic
